newsitem.title: INDIA: One killed, 14 injured in Kashmir grenade blasts.
newsitem.headline: One killed, 14 injured in Kashmir grenade blasts.

text.p: One person was killed and at least 14 injured on Friday when unidentified militants hurled two grenades at a bus in Kashmir, local police said.
They said the grenades exploded on the road in the Doderhama neighbourhood on the outskirts of Srinagar, the summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir state, and injured 15 people, two of them policemen.
One person died on the way to hospital and three were critically wounded, police said.
No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Doderhama is about two km (one mile) from a famous Hindu shrine, Khirbawani, where Kashmiri Hindus celebrate the "Mela Khirbawani" festival on June 13.

Jammu and Kashmir is mainly Hindu India's only Moslem-majority state, and more than a dozen rebel groups are fighting a separatist revolt there. Police and hospitals say more than 20,000 people have died in the region since the rebellion broke out in 1990.
